alert.note: Alert for North Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 11:16AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Itasca County through 1145 AM CDT... At 1116 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tenstrike, or 18 miles northeast of Bemidji, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Alvwood around 1140 AM CDT. Squaw Lake around 1145 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Whitefish Lake, Decker Lake, Wirt, Rosy and Dixon Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. If on a lake, get off or out of the water. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter inside a vehicle or sturdy structure now! Do not be caught on or in the water during a thunderstorm.
